name: Harissa
description: This spicy North African condiment has many versions, but usually contains dried hot red pepper, caraway, cumin and garlic. Just a small dab packs quite a punch, and can be used to brighten soups, sauces or marinades. Thinned with olive oil, it’s good drizzled over grilled meat or vegetables. Store it in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
recipeIngredient: 1 or 2 garlic cloves, smashed to a paste with a little salt
1/2 teaspoon caraway seeds, toasted and finely ground
1/2 teaspoon cumin, toasted and finely ground

recipeInstructions.text: Put pepper flakes in a small bowl. Cover with hot water for 5 minutes, then drain and return to bowl. Stir in garlic, caraway, hot paprika, cumin and olive oil. Store in small jar.
